full_text: Report from yesterday's meeting with Varadkar, Harris an other party leaders on Covid-19.  We must act now to close all non essential work places.  #COVID19ireland #Coronavirusireland #COVIDー19 #StopTheSpread #NonEssential https://t.co/K396B0qoRW

Off to briefing with Taoiseach now. Will be asking when non essential work will be stopping, when the 40,000 people waiting for tests, will be tested, how many private beds they have brought into the Public Health Service and what is happening with extra PPE. #COVID19  @rtenews

Funny neither ⁦@FineGael⁩ or ⁦@fiannafailparty⁩ were saying this on Thurs when ⁦@pb4p⁩ we’re the only ones who said it in the #Dail debate and proposed an amendment to give everyone a higher payment and they didn’t  support us. ⁦ https://t.co/wwrDsqtOV4

In the Dail this week I said €203  #Covid_19 payment is unacceptably low & proposed ALL get at least €305. Govt rejected our amendment. Yet, UK and many EU workers to get 70-80% of wages! Workers staying home are fighting #COVID19 & must be supported. #payworkers2stayhome https://t.co/zuGCypWyBK

@pb4p said in #Dail this week, €203  #Covid_19 payment is unacceptably low & proposed ALL get at least €305. Govt rejected our amendment. Yet, UK and many EU workers to get 70-80% of wages! Workers staying home are fighting #COVID19 & must be supported. #payworkers2stayhome

@pb4p said in #Dail on Thurs that €203 #Covid_19 payment was unacceptably low & proposed minimum €305 for ALL because everyone staying at home is helping fight the virus. Govt rejected our amendment! Yet most of Europe paying 75-80% of workers wages. #payworkerstostayathome https://t.co/Jj1gt9v5bb

Good that the government has conceded our proposed amendment that the draconian powers being established with this bill, will be time limited and can only be a extended  with a vote of the Oireachtas.

Attending the #Dail business committee this morning.  Will say, while we must fully respect public health advice, it's imperative that democracy continues to function.  Amendments on emergency legislation must be voted on & some functioning of Dáil and key cttees must continue.

@RTE_PrimeTime Incredible! Taoiseach announces absolutely nothing re income supports, mortgage/rent repayment and “the opposition” has nothing to say about it. We need a mortgage/rent amnesty. We need income guarantees for all. @MichealLehane @RTENewsPaulC @davidmurphyRTE

Let’s hope finally, ⁦@LeoVaradkar⁩ calls for closure of all non-essential services & work that we requested a week ago. We’ve lost time already-only max social distancing can reduce transmission & avert dire crisis  ⁦@pb4p⁩ ⁦@RTENewsNow⁩  https://t.co/bDGEqoMrVF
Update following Dail briefing on #coronavirus full video posted on my Facebook page https://t.co/lC9g6tK7Xu

going into leaders briefing on #COVID19. Unhappy with some answers we just received to questions we asked 1/2 weeks ago. Many questions unanswered & others with totally inadequate responses. Gov needs to publish all its expert advice so we know why they make decisions they make.

Just on my way to a briefing with all parties leaders on the #coronavirus, I will try to get answers to as many of the questions you have been asking me as possible, I will post another video update after the meeting. (full video on Facebook) # https://t.co/Rt5LV8cZgA

Attending all-party leaders briefing with Gov & health officials today: will ask why closures not urged for non-essential work, where social distancing impossible eg.Hairdressers, beauticians, restaurants etc Also questions remain about securing private capacity.  #CoronaIreland

The government must also move to secure incomes for the population, support essential workers and protect the elderly and vulnerable  Full statement here: https://t.co/ZzT0ib1mkr  #CoronaIreland #COVIDー19 #SocialDistancingNow https://t.co/b2nngFA8Sg

Today we urged the left to come together to #BreakTheCycle of FG/FF to form a left gov to take radical measures on housing, health & climate crisis & to give working people a break. We will vote for @MaryLouMcDonald for Taoiseach to form this gov and rule out deals with FF/FG https://t.co/aeOiyNgf1i

A minority left government could in its first 100 days:   Reverse the increase to the pension age   legislate to stop the sell off of public land that could be used for public housing   Move towards a national health service   Implement radical measures to combat climate change https://t.co/bw5x5Hx3IM

We can only deliver on the mandate for change that was clearly expressed by voters if we ensure that both FF and FG are ruled out of government.   I would urge parties of the left to come together and offer a genuine alternative to the politcs of FF/FG that have failed people. https://t.co/LhhUIVi8Kj
People voted for change and if FF/FG try to stop it then we would urge people out onto the streets if necessary to support a left minority government. https://t.co/i2Ge9WjDvV

Now is the time for the left to group together and try and offer a left wing alternative government to finally put an end to 100 years of Fine Gael and Fianna Fáil rule.  #breakthecycle https://t.co/WfBprTZW2Y

meeting @EamonRyan at 2 to discuss gov formation. Will be urging @greenparty_ie not to prop up a gov with FF/FG but to join with left to make a gov that will deliver on housing, health, climate and a fair deal for working people. @pb4p @RTENewsPaulC @MichealLehane @PatLeahyIT

Last day of canvassing. Heading out now. It’s freezing but we are determined to change this country. Thanks to my brilliant team and all the great support we are getting #BreakTheCycle #changeiscoming #VotePBP https://t.co/OqTwTUTGE7

@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork Insist that supermarkets use less wrapping. End privatisation of waste services. Tax corporations on amount of wrapping they use to fund clean ups.  I’m heading out for my last canvas now, so thanks a million for the brilliant questions!! 👊🏼
@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork Increase spending on services, move from medication to talk therapy. Develop wellness programmes in local community centres.
@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork Cut rates for small businesses. More funding for Local Gov. inter-cultural supports

@unicefireland Make Billionaires, big corporations & property speculators pay more tax to share the wealth of the country fairly. Organise key parts of the Economy(Housing, Health,Public Transport etc) on a not-for-profit basis to eliminate the Boom-Bust cycle.

@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork Incentivise farmers to be guardians of Nature & to plant native tree species, not Sitka Spruce plantations. Expand Coillte afforestation programmes with less focus on commercial profit & more on biodiversity. We stopped privatisation before & will always keep it public.

@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork @UnicefIRLyouth Curriculum reform with much wider subject choice, more practical life skills subjects, less focus on exams, smaller class sizes, more SNA supports, and better career guidance & mental health services.

@unicefireland @UnicefIRLyouth Better training for Guards to have less of a law & order approach and more focus on community support. More resources, services & facilities, particularly for young people in disadvantaged areas.
@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork No. Prohibition doesn’t work. It just drives things underground & creates greater health threats. We need better public health education initiatives.

@unicefireland @pb4p @StVincentsCork Provide proper youth services & facilities 1st to give young people alternatives. Better counselling, mental health & rehab services. Decriminalise drugs to take them out of criminal gang control.
@unicefireland #GE2020youth Ready to go! https://t.co/tNw8CV6eKW
